title: Bronze Elo
body:
Platinum Difficulty.

I main carries and was wondering if anyone had any ideas around the Item's Maw of Malmortius, Quicksilver Sash and Mercurial Scimitar.

I play all lanes (Support, Top, Bot, Mid and Jungle) but tend to play carries a lot, favouring the impact I can have on my games but often find playing Top lane very difficult and Jungle a little over-whelming, but I also find Mid lane to be a nightmare sometimes (So much to do, so many places to be).

I think warding has become a problem for mid-laners impact on the Game and all lanes have become linearised favouring pushers and single target bursters because of the freedom the warding trinket has provided, but found deep-warding to become severely difficult or simply something only supports can manage - in rare occasions.

Can we see some more stealth Characters or high roam characters Riot?

Also I think the items Mercurial Scimitar, Quicksilver Sash and Maw of Malmortius (Maw Less so) are far too Niche and maybe reworking these items or the addition of more offense based side-options (Say a different upgrade for Quicksilver Sash and maybe also changes to Mercurial Scimitar (More offense based) would greatly benefit many Champions Such as Riven (Quicksilver Sash suits her as does Mercurial but fails compared to a Guardian Angel in many Cases), Renekton (Maw of Malmortius suits Renekton while he often doesn't vs a Lot of AP Tops and I think because a lot of the Champions that should buy it - don't; the item should be more of an option for AD Ranged whilst still benefitting Hybridised offense/defense based Champions.

I'm open to Ideas I just think Quicksilver Sash - with such a split-second active - containing Magic resist, is a bit contradictory to its style and Maw of Malmortius benefitting damage when Low on HP suits Carries more than offtanks or hybridised offense/defense top laners and Junglers as the game is now.

Buying these 2 items in combination is almost never good however it opens up some pretty cool quick counter-plays and as I was disappointed however understanding of the reduction of Magic Resist over-all in the League, resulting in it I think in becoming more aggressive - but more linear in support of pushers and single-target bursters; and roaming etc has lost a lot of its effectiveness as well as the fun/chaos it adds to league.

Anyway I'm open-minded and was wondering if anyone had any thoughts about these items (And warding as it is now) and the Leagues Status Quo (Status atm) because I think a more educated player is a better player and maybe I am missing certain points or simply need new ideas for countering AP Champions as a Carry as well as would be happy to hear some Champions/builds for top laners - my builds thus far are very straight-forward and often pressured into countering certain Champions; and I find problems in doing so in a lot of games because of overly defensive items that suit other Champions or defensive items that don't suit Champions at all - warding is expensive and time-consuming now (working as intended?) - Not a lot of Assassins jungle but the new problem with warding (IMO) benefits them (Junglers like Lee Sin) unfairly as they tend to be lane-favoured (Except Lee Sin) - but should and would love too see some more aggressive build paths and items for carries, top laners and junglers.

Also, Bard is awesome btw great Champion - adds a lot of fun to games and I wish I owned him - might have to be next buy! And well done with the new jungle; played it a fair few times and found it very cool; and last but not least, thanks for providing such a great game and maintaining it - free of Charge!

-Kistorm.
"Buff ADC's, Supports OP!"

replies.body: Start playing freelosandra, you'll be outta bronze in no time.
I play her but not sure whether to Top or Mid, got good level 6 presence in mid but as a top laner I think her kit dominates lane but leaves her in a boring game.
thats why top laners take TP and TP bot a lot. Otherwise you have very little impact of the rest of the map.

I will never understand ward issues, at 9 you essentially get a sight stone and you only need to ward two places ( no not bushes ) granted other lanes put down at least one ward, both of which are a stone throw from lane.
